meanings.definition: Having a lot of resources or connections to draw from.
meanings.sent1: She is very sourceful and always knows where to find what she needs.
meanings.sent2: The sourceful student quickly found the answer in the library.
meanings.sent3: The sourceful detective solved the case in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a sourceful well of creativity, overflowing with ideas.
meanings.sent5: The sourceful explorer navigated the jungle with ease, using her knowledge of plants and animals.

meanings.definition: Able to find or provide sources for information or support.
meanings.sent1: He proved to be sourceful by locating the missing document in no time.
meanings.sent2: The sourceful librarian directed me to the right section for my research.
meanings.sent3: The sourceful friend always knows the best places to eat in town.
meanings.sent4: Her sourceful nature made her the go-to person for advice and guidance.
meanings.sent5: The sourceful team leader guided the project to success by tapping into various expertise.
